Format author information for BibTeX entries

Source: R/create_bibtex.R
format_bibtex_authors.Rd

Converts a data frame of author information into a properly formatted author string for BibTeX entries. Handles individual authors, organizations, and partial author information according to BibTeX conventions.

Usage

format_bibtex_authors(author_list)

Arguments

author_list

A data frame containing author information. Expected columns are:

  • family: Family/last name for individual authors

  • given: Given/first name for individual authors

  • name: Full name for organizational authors

Value

A character string containing the formatted author list for a BibTeX entry. Authors are separated by " and " as per BibTeX standards. If no valid authors are found, returns "Unknown".

Details

The function processes different types of author entities:

  • Individual authors: formatted as "Family, Given"

  • Organizations: enclosed in braces like "{Organization Name}"

  • Partial information: sses available name parts, with "Unknown" for missing family names

Special handling:

  • If the first author is an organization but individual authors follow, the organization is dropped to favor individual attributions

  • Empty or NULL author lists return "Unknown"

  • The function processes each row of the author_list data frame sequentially

See also

create_bibtex which uses this function to format author information in complete BibTeX entries.

Examples

# handle individual authors
authors <- data.frame(
  family = c("Smith", "Johnson", "Lee"),
  given = c("John", "Sarah", "David"),
  name = c(NA, NA, NA),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)
format_bibtex_authors(authors)
#> [1] "Smith, John and Johnson, Sarah and Lee, David"
# returns: Smith, John and Johnson, Sarah and Lee, David

# handle an organization as author
org_author <- data.frame(
  family = NA_character_,
  given = NA_character_,
  name = "National Science Foundation",
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)
# for organizations, the output will have the name wrapped in braces
result <- format_bibtex_authors(org_author)
# will return the organization name enclosed in braces

# handle mixed authors (organization will be dropped)
mixed <- rbind(org_author, authors[1, ])
format_bibtex_authors(mixed)
#> [1] "Smith, John"
# returns: Smith, John
